TITLE: Chaos in Kabul as Taliban take power and thousands try to flee
SUMMARY: Hundreds of people poured onto the tarmac at Kabul's international airport desperately seeking a route out of Afghanistan on Monday, after the Taliban's sudden seizure of power sparked a chaotic Western withdrawal and brought to a crashing end the United States' two-decade mission in the country.

TITLE: Opinion: 'It was avoidable' says Afghanistan's first female ambassador to the US
SUMMARY: Roya Rahmani is the first woman to serve as Afghanistan's ambassador to the United States, a position she held from 2018 until last month. Bergen spoke to her over the weekend about the fall of much of Afghanistan to the Taliban. Rahmani who is in the United States, says she worries that with the Taliban taking over, the civil wars that have wracked Afghanistan will continue. She is also concerned that the rights of Afghan women will disappear under their rule.

TITLE: US veterans disappointed with how the war in Afghanistan is ending

TITLE: Opinion: 3 ways companies can help advance racial equity
SUMMARY: Amid the national reckoning over racial inequality, corporations and foundations across the country have pledged roughly $11 billion to support causes that promote racial equity. Yet to date, only about half of that promised amount — roughly $5.8 billion — appears to have translated into real investments in the many organizations that are working day in and day out to create lasting change in communities of color. This slow pace of investment must be addressed if we are to successfully tackle the urgent and pervasive challenges before us.

TITLE: Opinion: Jurors sent a powerful message
SUMMARY: "I do not pretend to understand the moral universe," wrote anti-slavery Unitarian minister Theodore Parker in a sermon published in 1853. "The arc is a long one, my eye reaches but little ways; I cannot calculate the curve and complete the figure by the experience of sight; I can divine it by conscience. And from what I see I am sure it bends toward justice."

TITLE: Conviction of Arbery's killers puts new focus on first prosecutor
SUMMARY: Those demanding justice for Ahmaud Arbery want another conviction beyond the three White men found guilty of murdering the 25-year-old Black jogger running in their south Georgia neighborhood in 2020 - former Brunswick District Attorney Jackie Johnson. CNN's Martin Savidge reports.

TITLE: Photos: People we've lost
SUMMARY: Here are some of the most famous people who have died in 2021.

SUMMARY: "I do not pretend to understand the moral universe," wrote anti-slavery Unitarian minister Theodore Parker in a sermon published in 1853. "The arc is a long one, my eye reaches but little ways; I cannot calculate the curve and complete the figure by the experience of sight; I can divine it by conscience. And from what I see I am sure it bends toward justice."

SUMMARY: Those demanding justice for Ahmaud Arbery want another conviction beyond the three White men found guilty of murdering the 25-year-old Black jogger running in their south Georgia neighborhood in 2020 - former Brunswick District Attorney Jackie Johnson. CNN's Martin Savidge reports.

TITLE: A nanny faced a murder charge after a baby's death. Then things took a turn
SUMMARY: When a baby girl died of injuries doctors said were consistent with being shaken, her nanny faced a murder charge. Things took a turn when a small but vocal group of defense witnesses said the science behind shaken baby syndrome had been debunked - something mainstream medical organizations say isn't true. CNN's Sanjay Gupta reports.

TITLE: A 13-year-old's murder went cold for 22 years. Until now.
SUMMARY: CNN was granted exclusive access as the NYPD re-opened the cold case of 13-year-old Minerliz Soriano's murder. For nearly four years, the department's top detectives & forensics lab kept the case alive, culminating in a history-making arrest 22 years after her body was found in a dumpster.

TITLE: How GOP lawmakers want to change voting
SUMMARY: Republican state legislatures are looking to change the voting process by ending ballot boxes and changing ID requirements ahead of the 2022 midterm elections. CNN's Sara Murray reports.

TITLE: Bernstein: Voting rights fight is the top story
SUMMARY: Carl Bernstein calls the GOP "a party committed to keeping Americans from voting" and says of voter suppression, "We need to cover it like the war that it is, every day."

TITLE: DC joins other major US tourist cities turning to indoor vaccine or testing mandates
SUMMARY: If you want to enjoy an indoor meal, drinks or entertainment in some of the most popular urban escapes in the United States, you better have proof of vaccination or, in some cases, at least a negative result from a recent Covid-19 test with you.

TITLE: Workers are crying out for a four-day week. It's time for their bosses to pay attention
SUMMARY: A key lesson of the "Great Resignation" is becoming increasingly clear: It's time to shave a day off the workweek.

TITLE: Video shows which masks are most effective against Covid-19
SUMMARY: As the highly contagious Omicron coronavirus variant continues to spread, CNN's Randi Kaye takes a look at which type of mask offers the most protection against Covid-19.

TITLE: Video shows which masks are most effective against Covid-19
SUMMARY: As the highly contagious Omicron coronavirus variant continues to spread, CNN's Randi Kaye takes a look at which type of mask offers the most protection against Covid-19.

TITLE: The weirdest beauty trends to emerge from TikTok
SUMMARY: Another year of masks, "Zoom" face and excessive screen time appears to have knocked the beauty industry off its axis.

TITLE: Here's everything you need to know about ransomware
SUMMARY: Ransomware attacks are on the rise with an estimated $350 million paid out in ransom in 2020. Here's everything you need to know and how to prepare yourself if you're targeted next.

TITLE: Fast facts about tsunamis
SUMMARY: Here is a look at tsunamis.

TITLE: Heavy rain triggered a volcano eruption. This could happen more
SUMMARY: Indonesians are used to dealing with natural disasters. Their country sits on the Ring of Fire, a band around the Pacific Ocean that sets off frequent earthquakes and volcanic activity. But Mount Semeru's eruption on the island of Java Saturday was different.

TITLE: Opinion: Ghislaine Maxwell's conviction sends a vital message
SUMMARY: On Wednesday, Ghislaine Maxwell was found guilty of sex trafficking of a minor, transporting a minor with the intent to engage in criminal sexual activity and three related counts of conspiracy, but acquitted on a charge of enticing a minor to travel to engage in illegal sex acts.

TITLE: Opinion: This cake may change your mind on critical race theory
SUMMARY: Elliot Williams, CNN Legal Analyst and baker extraordinaire, breaks down why so many perceive critical race theory as a threat, and why they should be "cutting into" it, like a rainbow cake, instead. This video is part of CNN Opinion's "Elliot Williams Kneads to Know" series, where Williams tries to get the internet to pay attention to important issues by discussing them while baking.

TITLE: Infertility is not a risk with Covid-19 vaccines for kids
SUMMARY: It's among parents' top worries around kids getting vaccinated against Covid-19: Could the vaccine somehow impair their child's future fertility?

TITLE: A timeline of 22-year-old Gabby Petito's case
SUMMARY: The FBI has confirmed human remains found in a Florida park were those of Brian Laundrie, the fiancé of Gabby Petito, the 22-year-old woman whose case captured America's attention since she first disappeared.

TITLE: See video from traffic stop with Petito and Laundrie
SUMMARY: As the Moab City Police Department released more video of Gabby Petito from an August 12 traffic stop, the FBI returned to Brian Laundrie's family home in North Port, Florida, amid the ongoing search for him. CNN's Leyla Santiago reports.

TITLE: Opinion: The tragic messages the Gabby Petito case sends
SUMMARY: Gabby Petito's tragic case kicked off a national conversation about the lasting spotlight that is often given to missing White people, compared to their non-White counterparts. While Petito's family should of course be allowed to use everything at their disposal to get to the bottom of exactly what happened to Gabby, we cannot ignore the effects of that same level of access not being extended to the Black and brown, who are just as desperate to find missing loved ones.

TITLE: Autopsy shows Brian Laundrie died by suicide, attorney says
SUMMARY: Brian Laundrie died by suicide from a gunshot wound to the head, an attorney for the Laundrie family told CNN Tuesday.

TITLE: Missing gun belonging to Brian Laundrie's parents wasn't made public due to 'frenzied atmosphere,' family attorney says
SUMMARY: Brian Laundrie's parents discovered a handgun was missing when they voluntarily surrendered their firearms to law enforcement the same day they informed authorities that their son was missing, according to the family's attorney, Steven Bertolino.

TITLE: San Jose mayor: Gun owners should cover the cost of gun violence
SUMMARY: In my city, a mass shooting took the lives of nine people at a transit rail yard in May. In the three weeks since, while friends and family have grieved over their devastating loss, San Jose suffered about 15 more episodes of gun violence, according to San Jose Police Department records received by my office.

TITLE: 2021: The year Supreme Court conservatives made their mark
SUMMARY: Over the last year, the Supreme Court's newly solidified conservative majority has made clear that it is willing to forgo a deliberate pace of justice in favor of a race to the right, leaving behind the liberal justices and at times Republican-appointed Chief Justice John Roberts.

TITLE: This is the single most important political story in 2021
SUMMARY: Despite losses in the House, Senate, and the White House, Republicans still have one bright spot on the horizon: redistricting. In this latest episode of The Point, CNN's Chris Cillizza explains why district-drawing is so important.

TITLE: Flying without wings: The world's fastest trains
SUMMARY: As the world faces up to climate change, short-haul flights look increasingly unattractive to many travelers. The flygskam (flight shame) phenomenon that started in Scandinavia is already inspiring many travelers to reduce their reliance on airlines.

TITLE: Why snow isn't the only precipitation you need to worry about
SUMMARY: Not all winter storms drop fluffy white snowflakes.

TITLE: This 90-second exercise will help calm you down
SUMMARY: Dana Santas, a professional sports mind-body coach known as the Mobility Maker, shares a short, deep breathing exercise to help you relieve stress and lower blood pressure.

TITLE: How to fall asleep more quickly -- the healthy way
SUMMARY: Is falling asleep when your head hits the pillow what you're dreaming of?  A fast fall into the land of nod may seem like nirvana, but it's not a sign of a healthy sleeper.

TITLE: Chile's government distributed faulty birth control pills. Now more than 150 people are pregnant
SUMMARY: Leer en español

TITLE: 'Extremely disturbing': Reporter reacts to deadly rape in India
SUMMARY: An Indian woman allegedly assaulted and raped in Mumbai on Friday has died of her injuries, in a case activists say bears a striking similarity to the brutal 2012 gang-rape and murder of a student that prompted millions of women to push for tougher sexual assault laws in the country. CNN's  Vedika Sud reports.

TITLE: 16-year-old girl said she was raped hundreds of times
SUMMARY: At least seven men and one minor have been arrested in western India after a 16-year-old girl claimed she was raped hundreds of times in the latest horrifying case highlighting the country's problem with sexual violence.

TITLE: Video shows which masks are most effective against Covid-19
SUMMARY: As the highly contagious Omicron coronavirus variant continues to spread, CNN's Randi Kaye takes a look at which type of mask offers the most protection against Covid-19.

TITLE: They wanted a new life in America. Instead they were killed by the US military
SUMMARY: To the United States military, he was an ISIS-K facilitator they feared was involved in a plot to attack Kabul's international airport.

TITLE: She's nearly 3 but as small as an infant. This is the face of Afghanistan's hunger crisis
SUMMARY: Kamila is almost 3 years old, but she weighs just 11 pounds (5 kilograms). Her wrinkled skin sags off her skeletal limbs and stretches around her distended belly.
